mainstream.translation[1].definitions[0]: accepted by or involving most people in a society
Deaf children can often be included in mainstream education.
mainstream.translation[2].definitions[0]: to include a child with physical or mental problems in an ordinary class
mainstream.translation[3].definitions[0]: the most usual way of doing something or thinking about something
Depression-era laws have kept banks out of the mainstream of financial change.
mainstream.translation[3].definitions[1]: the people whose ideas about a subject are shared by most people and regarded as normal
He told readers he was trying to move the newspaper out of the opposition into the mainstream.
mainstream.translation[4].definitions[0]: relating to the most frequent or usual way of doing or thinking about something
The company has been selling interests that it considers to be outside its mainstream businesses.
The shop now caters for the mainstream market.
mainstream.translation[4].definitions[1]: suitable for normal people, rather than for a particular section of society
They made the clothes less high-fashion and more mainstream.
